Issues.Title: fix(ivy): Only restore registered modules if user compiles modules wi‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶th TestBed

There are a couple scenarios that are problematic and need special
handling:

1. A user has a custom implementation of lazy-loaded modules, sets some
provider overrides, then compiles the module so it can be loaded. In a
follow-up test, the user sets different overrides for the module and
then compiles. This is problematic because we need to be sure the module
registered in the first test is not used, so we need to clear it out of
the modules list in `ng_module_factory_registration`.
2. A user has a similar lazy-loaded module factory implementation but
relies on the module being registered automatically. This can happen,
for example, as a side effect of importing the ngfactory file.

Issues.Title: i18n - legacy message id mode
Issues.Body:
This PR is blocked on #32867 so only that last few commits are relevant.

Implements the [Legacy mode](https://hackmd.io/EQF4_-atSXK4XWg8eAha2g?both#Legacy-mode).

---

The `$localize` library uses a new message digest function for
computing message ids. This means that translations in legacy
translation files will no longer match the message ids in the code
and so will not be translated.

This commit adds the ability to specify the format of your legacy
translation files, so that the appropriate message id can be rendered
in the `$localize` tagged strings. This results in larger code size
and requires that all translations are in the legacy format.

Going forward the developer should migrate their translation files
to use the new message id format.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "i18n - legacy message id mode" (#32937)

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
It would be useful for `ViewRef` to have a reference to the enclosing `ViewContainerRef` to which the `ViewRef` is (possibly) attached to. 

An example use case is moving dynamic components around between different `ViewContainerRef`s. Depending on the underlying data structure model of the components, it might be cumbersome to have to keep a reference to the enclosing `ViewContainerRef` on the application side.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è-->
```TypeScript
// assume the following vars were previously created and have the following types:
// dynamicallyCreatedComponent: ComponentRef
// newViewContainerRef: ViewContainerRef
const oldViewContainerRef = dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView.enclosingViewContainerRef // the feature request is for something similar to this "enclosingViewContainerRef" property
const indexInOldViewContainer = oldViewContainerRef.indexOf(dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView)
oldViewContainerRef.detach(indexInOldViewContainer) // necessary because components have to be detached before they can be reinserted.
newViewContainerRef.insert(dynamicallyCreatedComponent.hostView)
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> The current workaround is to keep a reference to the enclosing ViewContainerRef inside the component instance, and update it whenever it changes (i.e whenever the component is moved to another ViewContainerRef).

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): speed up prop-based style/class bindings when no directives are present
Issues.Body:
Prior to this fix, whenever a prop-based style or class binding is
present, the binding application process would require an instance of
`TStylingContext` to be built regardless of whether or not any binding
resolution is needed (just so that it knows whether or not there are
any collisions). This check is, however, unncessary because if (and only
if) there are directives present on the element then are collisions
possible.

This patch removes the need for style/class bindings to register
themselves on to a `TStylingContext` if there are no directives and
no map-based bindings present on an element. This means that all
prop-based style/class bindings are applied directly as soon as the
first update pass is rendered on an element.

# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ x ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, it worked in Version 7.3 ### Description Providing the baseUrl as parameter is not provided to protractor config. It gets overriden by undefined. That happens because in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/8.3.x/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/protractor/index.ts at commit https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/7bd59980e4cc200cedd9c8666d8210ff928d3719 line 95 `baseUrl` is instantiated without providing a value, so it is undefined. It would only be overriden if devServerTarget is set. Then on line 149 protractor gets called with the baseUrl set to undefined, so the baseUrl from options gets overridden with undefined. ``` return await runProtractor(context.workspaceRoot, { ...options, baseUrl }); ``` To solve this, it would be enough to initialize baseUrl with options.baseUrl: `let baseUrl = options.baseUrl` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### protractor.conf.js ``` // Protractor configuration file, see link for more information // https://github.com/angular/protractor/blob/master/lib/config.ts exports.config = { allScriptsTimeout: 11000, specs: [ './src/**/*.e2e-spec.ts' ], capabilities: { 'browserName': 'chrome', chromeOptions: { args: ["--headless", "--disable-gpu", "--incognito", "--window-size=1920,1200"] } }, params: { base: '.' }, directConnect: true, framework: 'jasmine', jasmineNodeOpts: { showColors: true, defaultTimeoutInterval: 30000, print: function () { } }, onPrepare() { console.log('onPrepare'); console.log('baseUrl', browser.baseUrl); // Should log the provided baseUrl to the console }, }; ``` Executing `ng e2e --baseUrl=http://test.local/TICKET-1234` logs ``` onPrepare baseUrl ``` ## üî• Exception or Error All tests fail with wait timeouts, because baseUrl is undefined and browser.get complains about an invalid argument ``` - Failed: invalid argument (Session info: headless chrome=77.0.3865.75) (Driver info: chromedriver=77.0.3865.40 (f484704e052e0b556f8030b65b953dce96503217-refs/branch-heads/3865@{#442}),platform=Windows NT 10.0.17763 x86_64) (Session info: headless chrome=77.0.3865.75) (Driver info: chromedriver=77.0.3865.40 (f484704e052e0b556f8030b65b953dce96503217-refs/branch-heads/3865@{#442}),platform=Windows NT 10.0.17763 x86_64) at Object.checkLegacyResponse (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\error.js:546:15) at parseHttpResponse (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\http.js:509:13) at doSend.then.response (xxx\node_modules\selenium-webdriver\lib\http.js:441:30) at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:68:7) From: Task: WebDriver.navigate().to(http://localhost:1289012/) ``` ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: virtual-scroll - don't page out items if within selection
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

When selecting text within a CDK virtual scroll, it would be nice to keep items from being removed if they are currently within the selection (i.e. if items within the `Selection.anchorNode` and `Selection.focusNode` don't get paged out).

#### Use Case

Consider a virtual scroll with 100 items showing items 1-10. The user clicks and drags a selection to item 50 and then copies the selected text. If any of the items leave the CDK scroll buffer during this operation, the clipboard only contains the text for the items currently being shown in the buffer. This results in an unexpected experience for the user, who can scroll up and still see that the items appear to be visible in the scroll region.

Steps to reproduce:

3. Drag the items around, the host listeners do not fire when one item is dragged over another.

Native drag events should fire.

Native drag events do not fire.


#### Environment

- Browser(s): Chrome

#### What I'm Really Trying to Do

I want to make my own version of placeholders on top of the drag/drop api. I'm working on an app where the draggable items can take up most of the screen width, so we just want to show a line (in css just a border on whichever item as necessary, not an actual element) as a placeholder, that moves to the left side of an item if the user hovers over the left half and vice versa for the right. I'd like to use the dragenter/dragleave events to know when to apply the placeholder class to a certain item, because otherwise I pretty much have to calculate which item is being hovered based on the mouse position relative to the items in the drop list.

Issues.Title: Allow to insert a chip anywhere in the list (not always at the end)
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Nowadays you can only add chip to the end of your list. You can navigate with your keyboard but only to select them and eventually delete them. You can't place your cursor between two chips and add one in place. You also can't edit an existing chip. 

Thus if you have a list of four chips and want to replace the second one, you have to delete the last three chips, add your new one and re-add chips number 3 and 4.

And finally you can't cut paste a chip to change its position.

To say it shortly chips are not manageable like a piece of text in an input text. Thus they are quite monolithic and rigid today.

#### Use Case

In my case I want to use chips with autocompletion. People can choose an existing tag or add a new one but I want them to be able to change things without having to delete everything and restart ; meaning I want to be able to:

- insert a new chip with autocompletion wherever I want by placing my cursor anywhere (via keyboard arrows)
- cut paste chips to change order ; 
- reorder chips (via drag-and-drop)
- edit chips by double clicking it (with a custom function allowing you to decide if a chip is editable)

The idea behind this is to be able to compose a sentence with some parts (chips) picked from existing content (autocompletion) and others added dynamically on the moment.

After fighting a memory leak in my app (involving dynamically generating/removing CDK drag-drop items - and those removed items still lingering around in memory) for longer than I'd like to admit, I finally figured out the memory leak only occurs when the `cdkDrag` items contain a `cdkDragBoundary` property.

This bug was introduced in release 8.2.0 (#16874) when `_resizeSubscription` was added.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65986152-4f929080-e451-11e9-887f-a7b0a148442b.png)

All the subscriptions in the screenshot above are being unsubscribed in the `dragRef._removeSubscriptions()` method **except** for the `_resizeSubscription`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65986387-c16ada00-e451-11e9-9462-5d91b04e10ea.png)

As a result, the `_resizeSubscription` is not closed within the `dragRef.dispose()` method.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23387905/65985958-e6ab1880-e450-11e9-9d5f-57355cf0587e.png)

Simply adding `this._resizeSubscription.unsubscribe();` to the `dragRef._removeSubscriptions()` method appears to fix the problem.

I just double checked and the memory leak I am experiencing does not occur on CDK v8.1.4.


#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 8.2.0+
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[drag-drop] Memory Leak: DragRef _resizeSubscription - failing to unsubscribe" (#17255)

Issues.Title: Make eventListeners added by matTooltip passive to fix Lighthouse Error
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

This is based on the issue (https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/32733) reported in Angular repository.

As per the Developers Docs

> Add the passive flag to all of the event listeners that Lighthouse has identified. In general, add the passive flag to every wheel, mousewheel, touchstart, and touchmove event listener that does not call preventDefault().

Ref: https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/passive-event-listeners
 
But it seems that the event listeners added by `matTooltip` are not passive https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/tooltip/tooltip.ts#L241

Therefore, LightHouse throws error `Does not use passive listeners to improve scrolling performance`

#### Expected Behavior
Material components should follow passive event listeners guidelines available in Developers Docs.

#### Actual Behavior

LightHouse throws error `Does not use passive listeners to improve scrolling performance`

#### Environment

- Angular:9.0.0-next.8
- CDK/Material:8.1.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make eventListeners added by matTooltip passive to fix Lighthouse Error" (#17254)

Issues.Body:

because the `cp --no-preserve` flag is not supported by default.

This commit switches to a simple `chmod` call in order to make it

Issues.Title: perf(ripple): avoid page layouts from ripple elements
Issues.Body:
A while ago we removed the `transform` from the `.mat-ripple` element in order to avoid creating extra layers for elements that the user isn't interacting with. As a result the ripple elements can cause layouts to be triggered on the entire page, which is noticeable on larger pages (see #17252).

These changes are a hybrid solution where we add the `transform`, but only if the `.mat-ripple` element has content. This isn't bulletproof since the `:empty` selector can be invalidated by whitespace. For now this is our best solution that works across browsers, until the `contain` property gets better support.

Fixes #17252.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ripple): avoid page layouts from ripple elements" (#17253)

Issues.Title: build: tests should not fail if stylesheets contain quotes
Issues.Body:
Currently our workaround that allows us to use stylesheets
in the karma web test suites is not very robust and fails if
stylesheets use single quotes. e.g. `@material/linear-progress`:

https://unpkg.com/browse/@material/linear-progress@3.2.0/_mixins.scss

In order to fix this, we use double-quotes and always escape double-quotes
in the CSS content. This is still a bit hacky, but so is the overall workaround to
make it work.

Issues.Title: build: fix gulp release output not building
Issues.Body:
Even though we do not use the Gulp release output anymore, we should fix
it in case we need to roll-back the Bazel release output migration.

To fix the build, the flat module bundle for the Material primary entry-point has
been removed. We cannot use that anymore since there are no-exports in the
primary entry-point and having `index.ts` as entry-point and flat-module entry-point
the same time causes a NGC metadata bundle stack overflow exception (expected)

Additionally we no longer build the examples with Gulp since that migration was
already successful and the Gulp setup does not work with tertiary entry-points
which are extensively used in the examples package.

Issues.Title: Moment date adapter with Material datepicker strict mode issue
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qn3txm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Strict mode for moment adapter is turned on in app.module providers section
2. valuechanges is set up at the form
3. When user starts typing in date, for instance types in "10" and stops, the valuechanges should fire with the value of Moment date object being invalid (invalid: true).
4. Currently it fires with the Moment date value being expanded to 10/01/2019, making it valid date. Now, this could be ok behaviour prior we had the strict mode or when strict mode is off but not when it is turned on.
 
#### Expected Behavior

For incomplete dates entered into the form the Datepicker/Moment date adapter currently works in a way of "autocompleting" the value to the current month, which is unwanted when strict mode in turned on.

#### Actual Behavior

If user enters "10" currently the datepicker/dateadapter expands it to 10/1/2019 (for default en-us locale being in use). Even when strict mode is on.

#### What behavior were you expecting to see?

The Moment value from the datepicker value should be invalid (or maybe null).

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
- Browser(s): latest chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10

Issues.Title: Add @Input to allow a custom class to be added to HTML elements that are directly replaced by mat- components
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

For mat-* elements that replace HTML elements directly (i.e. mat-checkbox, mat-select), the ability to apply a class to the base element via an @Input or other property would add options for interacting with third-party libraries that are not directly compatible.

Note that this functionality would be similar to the panelClass implementations on other material components (e.g. [MatSnackBar](https://material.angular.io/components/snack-bar/api))

#### Use Case

Consider this example using the angular2-hotkeys library:

[](https://components-issue-qi8zq1.stackblitz.io/)

The library (based on the Mousetrap library) contains logic that prevents hotkey events from propagating when an `input`, `textarea`, or `select` element is focused. By design this can be bypassed if the "mousetrap" class is added to the target element. In the example above, you can see that adding the class to a mat-checkbox is insufficient for bypassing this logic as it must be on the base input element explicitly. Currently there is no way of doing that declaratively, so the hacky solution involves accessing the VIewChild through a (presumably) hidden property and manually adding it at runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add @Input to allow a custom class to be added to HTML elements that are directly replaced by mat- components" (#17238)

Issues.Title: Snackbar immediately closes if duration is above 1e+21
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://stackblitz.com/angular/jrnynrjaqdo
2. Display a snackbar with duration `durationInSeconds = 1e+21;` or `Number.MAX_VALUE`
3. Launch the snackbar
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The snackbar should be displayed for a (very) long time.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Snackbar automatically closes itself after ~300ms.

It seems snackbar doesn't handle numbers with `e` format starting at `e+21`, eg it supports `1+e10` but not `1+e21` or above.

- Angular: 8.2.8
- CDK/Material: 8.2.1
